intro: Corydalis scaberula var. ramifera, commonly known as the rough corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and clusters of small, pinkish to purple flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds, and its leaves are typically narrow and have a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
